etymology.description: 粽(粽) (zòng, "sticky rice wrapped in leaves") and 子(子) (zi, "child; small thing") together mean a small bundle of sticky rice, which is typically wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves to form a dumpling.
etymology.interpretation: 粽子 (zòngzi, "rice dumpling") is a traditional Chinese food commonly eaten during the Dragon Boat Festival. Its shape and preparation symbolize unity and togetherness, as families often make and enjoy them together.

examples.chinese: 端午节时家家户户都会包粽子(端午節時家家戶戶都會包粽子)。
examples.pinyin: Duān wǔ jié shí jiā jiā hù hù dōu huì bāo zòng zi.
examples.english: During the Dragon Boat Festival, every household makes rice dumplings.

examples.chinese: 妈妈做的粽子味道鲜美(媽媽做的粽子味道鮮美)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā zuò de zòng zi wèi dào xiān měi.
examples.english: The rice dumplings made by mom taste delicious.
